column1: Which grade or grades did Martin Luther King Jr. skip?
column8: He skipped both 9th and 12th grades, which meant he was a freshman at Morehouse College in Atlanta when he was only 15! He got a bachelor's degree in Sociology.

column1: During the civil rights movement, how many times did Martin Luther King go to jail?
column8: Martin Luther King went to jail 29 times during the civil rights movement, for civil disobedience and on trumped-up charges — talk about commitment!

column1: Martin Luther King was in Memphis, Tennessee, when he was shot on a motel balcony. Why was he in Memphis?
column8: He was in Memphis to support a strike by sanitation workers, who were protesting against low wages and poor working conditions.
column10: He was speaking at the University of Memphis.
column12: He was in Memphis to support a strike by sanitation workers, who were protesting against low wages and poor working conditions.

column1: How old was Martin Luther King when he was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize?
column8: He was 35, which at the time made him the youngest person ever to receive the award. When selected, MLK decided to donate the prize money — $54,123 — to further the civil rights movement. As of 2014, Malala Yousafzai is the youngest recipient of the Nobel Peace Prize ever (she was just 17 when she won!).

column1: What was the name of the first book Martin Luther King wrote?
column8: His first book was “Stride Toward Freedom: The Montgomery Story,” a memoir published in 1958 that describes the Montgomery bus boycott. This 13-month long protest was sparked by the arrest of Rosa Parks in 1955, and involved African-Americans refusing to ride public transit because of segregated seating.
